meanings.definition: To stab or lift with a pitchfork.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was pitchforking hay into the truck.
meanings.sent2: She was pitchforking the pile of leaves into a neat stack.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was pitchforking acorns around the yard.
meanings.sent4: His words pitchforked into her heart, leaving her feeling hurt.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pitchforking motion stuck in his mind like a sharp thorn.

meanings.definition: To move or lift with a pitchfork.
meanings.sent1: He was pitchforking the compost into the garden beds.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was pitchforking the bales of hay onto the loft.
meanings.sent3: The kids were pitchforking the sand in the sandbox for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas pitchforked her to the top of the company.
meanings.sent5: The strong man was pitchforking heavy crates effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: The journalist was pitchforking the politician's actions in the article.
meanings.sent2: She felt like her colleagues were pitchforking her work during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was pitchforking jokes at the audience all night.
meanings.sent4: His words pitchforked through the silence, causing tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The coach was pitchforking feedback to the players to improve their performance.
